meanings.definition: More cheerful or lively in manner or mood.
meanings.sent1: She felt chirpier after spending time with her friends.
meanings.sent2: The children at the party were much chirpier than the adults.
meanings.sent3: His chirpier attitude was contagious, making everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The chirpier colors of spring brightened up the whole neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The chirpier music lifted her spirits instantly.

meanings.definition: Making a series of high-pitched sounds like a bird.
meanings.sent1: The chirpier birds outside woke her up early in the morning.
meanings.sent2: The chirpier sound of the crickets filled the night air.
meanings.sent3: The chirpier alarm clock was not a pleasant way to wake up.
meanings.sent4: The chirpier sound of the wind through the trees was soothing.
meanings.sent5: The chirpier noise of the squirrel made her smile.
